Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw and correctly label a fish and its immediate water habitat, like a pond or ocean.
The student can include and label at least one or two other plants or animals that might coexist in the same water habitat.
The student can show some resources the fish needs to survive, such as water and food (e.g., labeling 'water' and a food source like 'algae').
The student can illustrate how the fish uses its habitat to meet its needs, such as swimming freely in water, with labels indicating this behavior.
CANNOT: The student might only partially show how parts of the habitat, such as plants and animals, are interconnected (e.g., labels might not fully connect relationships like predator-prey or plant-animal interactions).

The student may overlook labeling some elements or relationships within the habitat as a system, such as how plants provide oxygen, or may not clearly connect all resources and interactions (e.g., *(student may not label plants as providing shelter)*).
